description: Excavation to provide a lightwell to existing basement
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Site Location and Block Plan (Drawing number: 200); Existing Basement Plan (Drawing number: 001); Existing Ground Plan (Drawing number: 002); Existing Front Elevation (Drawing number: 003); Existing Section A-A (Drawing number: 004) Revision A; Existing Section B-B A (Drawing number: 005) Revision A; Existing Site Plan (Drawing number: 006); Proposed Basement Plan (Drawing number: 201); Proposed Front Elevation (Drawing number: 203); Proposed Section A-A (Drawing number: 204); Proposed Site Plan (Drawing number: 206); Proposed Front Elevation Inc Lightwell (Drawing number: 207); Proposed Plan Front Garden (Drawing number: 208); Proposed Sides Elevations to Bay Window (Drawing number: 209);
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the
existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the basement development hereby approved, a construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works. Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2026), policy LV 7.A, of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.1, 6.2 and 6.3 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to the commencement of the basement development, a sustainable drainage strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy shall include a detailed drainage design (incl. drawings and supporting calculations) and maintenance plan (incl. maintenance tasks for all drainage components) that demonstrate the reduction of flood risk (betterment of exiting drainage) at the site through sustainable drainage mitigation techniques. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and permanently retained and maintained.

REASON: To reduce surface water run-off and the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2016); 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The proposed basement playroom shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the development hereby approved, and shall not be used for habitable accommodation, as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
